glsa.title: xdelta: User-assisted execution of arbitrary code
glsa.synopsis: A buffer overflow in xdelta might allow remote attackers to execute arbitrary code.

background.p: Xdelta is a C library and command-line tool for delta compression using VCDIFF/RFC 3284 streams.

description.p: A buffer overflow can be triggered within xdelta when ran against a malicious input file.

impact.p: A remote attacker could coerce the victim to run xdelta against a malicious input file. This may be leveraged by an attacker to crash xdelta and gain control of program execution.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.
